title: James Blunt says he will ‘never be cool’ and same
text:
James Blunt says he will ‘never be cool’ (Picture: Getty Images)

James Blunt has joked he will never be cool, and we’re feeling it.

The 45-year-old is preparing to drop his new album Once Upon A Mind, which he claimed is even more depressing than his previous releases.

And while promoting his latest project he told the Daily Star that no matter how hard he tries to be cool, it just doesn’t work out for him.

We can relate.

When chatting to the publication, he recalled one of the times he performed at Glastonbury and how his attempt at impressing fans didn’t go to plan.

He said: ‘I’d love to be cool but I’m never gonna get that title.

He had an awkward moment at Glastonbury (Picture: Getty Images)

‘The nearest I got to being cool was at Glastonbury and I was playing on the Pyramid Stage and I thought I’ll crowd surf.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

He added: ‘So I threw myself off the stage and I crowd surfed as the sun was going down at Glasto and I thought you know what, “I am cool, I am!”

‘Then I went back to the stage and I realised it was too high for me to climb back on and there was a man on the stage and I looked into his face and said, “Help me.”‘

Unfortunately for James, he was talking to a BBC cameraman, and he’d whispered his plea for help to the entire nation.

The star is set to drop his album later this month (Picture: Getty Images)

The You’re Beautiful hitmaker is set to release his new album later this month, and it sounds melancholy.

Speaking to Bang Showbiz earlier this year, he gave a sneak peek at what fans can expect from his upcoming tracks.

‘I am a musician and I’m writing songs, so watch this space,’ he explained.

‘I’ve just come off 18 months on the road so I’ve just washed my clothes and I’m back in the studio.’

The singer-songwriter added: ‘Misery sells and I know a few people that have died, and a few have been born, so I’m writing about those.’

Metro.co.uk have reached out to James’ reps for further comment.
